Field Detail

CheckCenter

public static final boolean CheckCenter
Should the tiling algorithm check the center of the tile, as well as the corners to determine if it should be considered for being in the target?

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MegaScan

public static final boolean MegaScan
Should all pixels be scanned in every tile be scanned, or just the corners (and possibly center)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

MinBlobSize

public static final int MinBlobSize
A calibration constant indicating the minimum size for a potential target to be considered. This number is given in square "tiles", with Step pixels side lengths

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Sensitivity

public static final int Sensitivity
A constant between -128 to +127 indicating how sensitive the color acceptance of the target should be. Lower numbers will allow more pixels, while higher numbers will eliminate more.
This number needs to be chosen high enough to reduce or eliminate false positives, but it needs to be low enough to not generate false negatives.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ShowDebugInfo

public static final boolean ShowDebugInfo
Should debug info be shown? This includes time per frame, number of visible targets, and estimated position of visible targets.

See Also:

Side_Bottom

public static final int Side_Bottom
Constants indicating the Left, Top, Right, and Bottom sides of a target or bounding box.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Step

public static final int Step
The size of each tile in the vision processing. This is represented in pixels. It should be a number chosen large enough to have a good speed, but small enough to not miss a target in the image.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

loopAndProcessPreSavedPics

public void loopAndProcessPreSavedPics()
                                throws java.io.IOException
